        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="7052" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="7052" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.29</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="1273">1,273</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="100"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Opus 1870</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Aromatic Spicy fragrance for men. <b>Opus 1870</b> was launched in 2005. Top notes are Pepper, Yuzu, Coriander, Juniper, Pink Pepper, Bergamot and Cardamom; middle notes are Incense, Rose, Cinnamon and Orris Root; base notes are Virginia Cedar, Sandalwood, Musk, Amber, Leather and Vanilla. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a     </div>

</pros-cons><div class="cell small-12"><p class="info-note" style="font-size: smaller"><b>Note:</b> The pros and cons listed on this page have been generated using the artificial intelligence system, which analyzes product reviews submitted by our members.             <span class="clickcatcher"></span><h4>The Scent of Books in Perfumery</h4>
        </a>
        <p>by <i>Elena Prokofeva</i></p>

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2095902" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysticalArugula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysticalArugula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2095902ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2095902" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303">MysticalArugula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-18">03/18/24 01:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Peppery Yuzu Musk Such a wonderful EDT that is more intimate but has a better hold compared to other fragrances! I love how peppery and fluffy it feels on my skin I would say it's more powdery than floral even with the rose After an hour, it somehow turns a just a tad bit sour on my skinThis could really work for an everyday wear to work, however I wish there was a bit of iris to give this fragrance more personality rather than just a peppery clean.<br />
<br />
Zodiac Trio<br />
Aquarius Gemini Libra</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="2095902"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=2095902#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2087115" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1410281">Dumbplings</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-09">03/09/24 09:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Since YSL l'homme ultime was discontinued I layer opus with byredo gypsy water just because this is the only fragrance that has that same type of fresh rose and light airiness to it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="2087115"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=2087115#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2048729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2048729" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Owen Bawn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740382"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1740382.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Owen Bawn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Touch-for-Men-815.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.815.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Touch for Men"title="Touch for Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2048729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2048729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740382">Owen Bawn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-01">02/01/24 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am quite taken with Opus 1870. My taste runs to subtle and discreet old fashioned fragrances. They don't have to be from 1900 but I like fragrances in which I can sense a connection to the past. Important for a house like Penhaligon's. I understand that their penny counting masters require now that they churn out strong and popular scents, but for the most part they're not for me. But they still create masterpieces with that historical connection from time to time. Castile, Endymion, Bayolea, and Lothair all fit that category. As does Opus 1870. I get the citrus and the pepper, the light rose and the incense, and the soft woody base. It's a fine cold weather fragrance for close quarters. Give me Opus 1870 by day, and Endymion by night and I'll be content from now till Easter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="2048729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=2048729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Peppery cedar, just a bit of incense, a bit of citrus..everything blended to perfection. English understatement i guess. Reminds me of a cross of Royal Oud and Lalique White.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1793605"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1793605#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1787167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1787167" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tacoscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674105"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1674105.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tacoscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Essential-Parfums/Fig-Infusion-73092.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73092.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fig Infusion"title="Fig Infusion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1787167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1787167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674105">Tacoscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-19">03/19/23 02:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourites from Penhaligons. <br />
<br />
Bright citrus and pepper opening which dries down to a beautiful cedar/incense. It feels refined and confident, theres nothing try hard about Opus. <br />
<br />
Projection is minimal however longevity is great on me and the skin scent lasts all day, I find this of a lot of Penhaligons. <br />
<br />
Perfect work scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1787167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1787167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1749885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Have bathed since and can still smell it on my wrists. Elegant and quietly powerful. Lovely stuff</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1749885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1749885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1748760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1748760" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vitodito"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303546"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1303546.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vitodito" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1748760ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1748760" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303546">Vitodito</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-01">02/01/23 02:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I became really obsessed with this scent. <br />
<br />
Its really really classic, elegant, smart and fortunately it doesnt smell fougere to me. Its just a classy classic men smell. <br />
<br />
I would definitely classify it into the 35+ male category, and i can barely detect any listed note. Maybe i would describe it as a fresh spicy scent? <br />
<br />
As usual within this world, i disagree with the performance rhates, as i can easily smell it after a lot of hours, and people around me too. If youre used to spray 8-10 sprays of strong extracts, and maybe use 3-4 perfumes a day, that might be the reason why you are not happy with its performance. <br />
<br />
Lovely for every time of the year altough i would say spring and autumn might be its best time, any occasion any dress. <br />
Slight similarity with Mechant Loup and a very little Gucci vibe, but not a copy at all of any of them. They just share some small similar parts. <br />
<br />
Thanks for reading :-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1748760"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1748760#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1722851" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1722851" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="u24masonl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1291723"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1291723.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="u24masonl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1722851ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1722851" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1291723">u24masonl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-01">01/01/23 21:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got bought this scent for my birthday and I absolutely love it! As soon as I first sprayed it on, I thought to myself that it leans towards being a more masculine scent, and I still believe that to be true. But I adore a unisex perfume (Tom Ford's offerings being a personal favourite) and I think this smells very sexy on my skin. I did ask my husband whether he thought it smelled masculine on me and he was very surprised that I would even suggest it.<br />
<br />
On me, the yuzu and the coriander stands out for the first thirty minutes, then it mellows into a spicier, muskier scent. To me it almost smells of fresh, unsmoked tobacco after a while. But the yuzu stays put, keeping it smelling zingy.<br />
<br />
It is not like any other scent I own; fresh and masculine, distinctive, grown up, refined. It smells expensive (but then, it is). The sillage and staying power is also fantastic. A firm favourite of mine now, and I will replace the bottle after it is finished.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1722851"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1722851#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1721462" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1721462" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coalita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246160"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1246160.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coalita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boadicea-the-Victorious/Boadicea-Glorious-16086.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16086.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boadicea Glorious"title="Boadicea Glorious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1721462ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1721462" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246160">Coalita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-31">12/31/22 01:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very, very beautiful fragrance! Love it so much! It's fresh and spicy and gourmand with cinnamon and soft sandal. Perfect, bright and lifts up mood. Wish more longevity and sillage. Too weak. Unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1721462"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1721462#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1699278" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1699278" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andyjones"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1527562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1527562.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andyjones" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1699278ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1699278" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1527562">Andyjones</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-30">11/30/22 11:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If one Man could pull this off to perfection it would be James Bond. Love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1699278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1699278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1692815" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1692815" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dpark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516832"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516832.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dpark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1692815ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1692815" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516832">dpark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-20">11/20/22 20:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have trouble identifying some of the notes in this.  It's very bright in the immediate opening and moderately aldehydic. Beyond that, there's definite spiciness.  Some sweetness.  Some woodiness. <br />
<br />
There's some other note(s) I can't place.  Something toasted-smelling.  It creates a pastry or bread-type feel for me.  It's almost like a spiced dessert of some sort, but I cannot place what it reminds me of, nor what note(s) are creating this.  Maybe it's the incense but it doesn't really smell like it.  Something vaguely gourmand and spicy.<br />
<br />
In the dry down the rose and spice create a bit of a potpourri feel, but it's quite subtle, and not unpleasant.<br />
<br />
Overall, this is fairly pleasant and I find this quite intriguing, but it's not really something I find myself reaching for.  It's more interesting than it is pleasant or compelling for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1692815"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1692815#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1637383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1637383" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Xeryus-861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Xeryus"title="Xeryus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1637383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1637383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716">Glyph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-03">09/03/22 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A gentlemanly fragrance, which is very typical for Penhaligon's; but I just didn't love this the way I love Endymion (or the way I've grown to love Quercus). It is composed of black pepper, yuzu, and woods with some rose buried deep inside of it. It just didn't make much of an impression on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1637383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1637383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1616798" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1616798" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gammergq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347633"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1347633.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gammergq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1616798ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1616798" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347633">Gammergq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-04">08/04/22 08:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Incredibly elegant is a nice sharp relaxing scent which like most Penhaligon scents is very subtle but you catch the occasional whiff time again, would be elevated to Distinction mark if it wasn't for its performance.<br />
<br />
Rating: Merit (B)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1616798"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1616798#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1580895" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1580895" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spitshaw"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="spitshaw" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1580895ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1580895" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471472">spitshaw</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-09">06/09/22 08:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some say it's boring, some say it's safe. Some say it's nothing special. The first two bits are true but that's exactly what makes it special. Opus is a beautiful, subtle scent that fits any occasion.  It doesn't shout, but it's an exquisite and refined scent that's magnificently mature without being stuffy. The combination of pepper and cinnamon with the yuzu and light rose is to die for, and the way it morphs to and fro between pepper, wood and citrus is *chef's kiss*. It's somehow warm and comforting yet light and refreshing at the same time. An underated masterpiece imo.  Everyone needs a fragrance like this, I know I can't stop wearing mine! <br />
<br />
 Ps. keep an eye out for Penhaligon's twice yearly unboxed sale (sign up to their mailing list to get notified) - as you can usually grab this for 59 - which at that price is literally unbeatable!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1580895"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1580895#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1564757" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1564757" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CrossCentury"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="CrossCentury" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Pegasus-16938.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16938.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pegasus"title="Pegasus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1564757ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1564757" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1468487">CrossCentury</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-15">05/15/22 21:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Agree with rezzmails comment below.<br />
Opus 1870 is really amazing and suited for every occasion. Id consider it to be a perfect office fragrance as it is quite light and inoffensive.<br />
<br />
IMHO it leans masculine instead of being unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1564757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1564757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1547211" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1547211" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rezzmail"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370230"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1370230.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rezzmail" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/Obsession-248.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.248.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Obsession"title="Obsession"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1547211ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1547211" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1370230">rezzmail</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-20">04/20/22 09:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had no idea this was a men's scent, I simply thought it was unisex, but considering my growing men's fragrance collection, it doesn't change much in my review.<br />
<br />
Opus is such a smooth, smokey, and refined cologne. It's like an everyman scent that doesn't conjure much in terms of a particular scent family as it mingles in and out of spices, citrus, and woods. I got a sample of this since I've found myself attracted to Penhaligons and their overall aesthetic. Opus 1870 is such a smart scent for how mundane and everyday it is, the perfect signature scent that caters to the whole year. Something that doesn't need to be flashy, that just leaves me to get lost in it's simplicity. As a student, it really adds to the cool and collected vibe of academia. I can easily see myself buying a full bottle some time in the future.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1547211"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1547211#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1513262" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1513262" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DrNDJas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063104"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1063104.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DrNDJas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/L-Anarchiste-6380.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6380.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Anarchiste"title="L'Anarchiste"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1513262ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1513262" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063104">DrNDJas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-27">02/27/22 16:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an incredible fragrance because it is not all that remarkable, but it remains exquisite.  Theres nothing coming from this bottle that will blow your mind, but it will remind you of just how blissful something understated can be. <br />
Its so simple but is done so well. Masculine, classy, woody, fresh, lightly spicy. Superb</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1513262"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1513262#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1440623" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1440623" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Finbar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Finbar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1440623ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1440623" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404900">Finbar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-05">11/05/21 10:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is such a surprise , I love Penhaligons but this is really unique, in a good way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1440623"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1440623#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1430803" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1430803" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OntheMark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1078464.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="OntheMark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Pour-Homme-II-1119.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1119.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Pour Homme II"title="Gucci Pour Homme II"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1430803ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1430803" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078464">OntheMark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-19">10/19/21 09:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sneaky good stuff.  Deceptively complex and performant -- just not loud.<br />
<br />
Over time, my respect for what Penhaligon's did with this one has only grown.  There are no rough edges to Opus 1870, none at all.  All its notes -- and I do pick up most of them at various times -- are handled with such delicacy as to almost reduce Opus to being dull and boring.  But how could it be, when it's always changing, always revealing something new to its wearer and those near him (or her)?  At the opening, I feel lots of pepper (black and some pink) and a smooth hit of yuzu, all with a hovering wisp of embers in the background.  There seems to be something decidedly British about its opening, though I'm not sure how to describe it.  Over time, that opening merges with some sweetness and soft but pronounced spiciness (cinnamon and clove rose, maybe a touch of cardamom) that brings to mind almost a lightly smoked chai vibe.  All the while, a very subtle, almost powdery wood combo under-girds the whole experience, anchoring it for a deceptively long wear.  On the whole, I find Opus to be ethereal in its lightness and iridescent in its many subtle facets.  It only radiates about arm's length at most, but it does stick around a good 4-6 hours or more, depending on how you wear it.  <br />
<br />
No, it's not a screamer.  Performance blah blah blah.  Performance be damned.  Here's the thing: If you wear fragrances to garner compliments and get noticed, you wear something with "punch" -- but punch does not equate to quality.  Sometimes you wear something to please yourself and reward those who venture in close.  For me, Opus 1870 is a phenomenal fall/winter/evening scent that is light enough to pull off anytime you want to feel and exude contentment, equanimity and authentic kindness.  For those who are familiar, it's like an airy, yuzu-backed blend of Loewe 7 Anonimo and Gucci Pour Homme II.  Not the same exactly, but like both in some ways.  In spite of the similarities, there is nothing out there that is quite like Opus.  I give Penhaligon's high marks for uniqueness and artistic approach for this one.  It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but I really appreciate and love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1430803"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1430803#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1421120" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1421120" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlueMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlueMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1421120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1421120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683">BlueMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-02">10/02/21 20:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>DAY-TO-DAY<br />
<br />
Likable, fresh, daily scent - an easy-to-wear spray and go that has a touch of class. <br />
<br />
It's going on the short list for xmas.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1421120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1421120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1418856" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1418856" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ikea pencil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327427"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1327427.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ikea pencil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1418856ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1418856" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327427">ikea pencil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-28">09/28/21 22:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely peppercorn incense with soapy accords and hints of citrus.<br />
<br />
What an excellent office scent! The coriander and cedar give this a warm soapy feeling while the yuzu gives this an edge. They're both over a beautifully blended incense and pepper that are so heavy and deep. The latter is incredibly potent and comforting when you let it sit for a bit. On the whole this feels very tame and clean without being generic or boring. I imagine a well put-together man wearing this for a business-casual affair (This is inherently more masculine but I can see a woman destroying with this too). I appreciate how light the sillage is -- it reinforces this "I want to smell good but I'm not gonna put in your face" kind of attitude. Reserved but well-groomed.<br />
<br />
This is a winner.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1418856"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1418856#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1405084" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1405084" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nabs1212"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1384580"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1384580.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nabs1212" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1405084ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1405084" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1384580">nabs1212</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-05">09/05/21 16:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok perfume. Smells very similar to spicbomb, spicy at the same time smells very fresh . Dry down is also nice . It's a very unique take on a perfume and is very masculine. Dry down is a musky woody kind of smell. Only problem is the performance, maximum 2 hours if you're generous with the spray . But stays on clothes longer, I would still smell the woody dry down the next day if I spray on clothes! <br />
<br />
Scent : 6/10<br />
Unique: 7/10<br />
Longevity 4/10<br />
Projection:4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1405084"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1405084#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1345700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1345700" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thefatbaby614"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1175354"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1175354.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thefatbaby614" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Elysium-Pour-Homme-Eau-Intense-81839.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81839.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elysium Pour Homme Eau Intense"title="Elysium Pour Homme Eau Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1345700ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1345700" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1175354">thefatbaby614</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-19">05/19/21 04:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my new favorite light scent. Perfect inoffensive, refreshing, non-blue fragrance. I highly recommend this to anyone interested.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1345700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1345700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1281779" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1281779" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Michelle12345678"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1014935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1014935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Michelle12345678" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-70015.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70015.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold +"title="Gold +"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1281779ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1281779" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1014935">Michelle12345678</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-25">01/25/21 15:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cedar, woody, slightly spicy. Soft. Leans masculine but anyone could wear it. Leans more towards a serious and mature man, but again, anyone could wear it. Staid. Quiet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1281779"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1281779#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1269756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1269756" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Giuseppevi88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136114"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1136114.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Giuseppevi88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1269756ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1269756" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136114">Giuseppevi88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-03">01/03/21 04:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aerial manly sexiness at its best.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1269756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1269756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1213866" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1213866" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gmr1967"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241164"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1241164.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gmr1967" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1213866ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1213866" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241164">gmr1967</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-20">08/20/20 06:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A classic for this Maison, definitely masculine but that I love to wear when I want to take a break from decidedly more "commercial" fragrances. And to be included in a collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1213866"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1213866#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1206546" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1206546" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mofrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1197251"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mofrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Abel/Black-Anise-81517.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81517.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Anise"title="Black Anise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1206546ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1206546" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1197251">mofrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-01">08/01/20 21:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reading other reviewers comments, Im not sure what is meant by poor performance. Is it the longevity or silage? The longevity is what is expected from an EDT and the silage is moderate to heavy for good reasons.<br />
<br />
Opus 1870 is a woody musky fragrance from Penhaligons. The scent starts with a blast of yuzu and black pepper. The pepper does not last long but remains in the background. Throughout the fragrance development the yuzu remains consistent and gives the scent a fresh side. Personally, I dont get much of the coriander, rose, and cinnamon in the process. The woody incense notes then become prominent and remain for a while. The fragrance ends with a clean musky base that remains the longest. Even though marketed for men I think it is unisex.<br />
<br />
As for the performance, I get about 4 hours on skin and solid 7-8 hours on clothes. Sometimes I smell the musky woody base on my clothes the next day. The projection however is moderate and I think for good reasons. For this type of scent it would be best to have low silage. At high doses the incense becomes really prominent and sharp. Spray too much and it quickly becomes offensive! Three sprays will do the job. 9/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1206546"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1206546#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1167620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1167620" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kamranwolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1234922"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1234922.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kamranwolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alfred-Dunhill/Dunhill-1939.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1939.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dunhill"title="Dunhill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1167620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1167620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);
