align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1167620"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1167620#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1115236" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1115236" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SMAinHK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1172535"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1172535.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SMAinHK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Oriental-Leather-55347.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55347.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oriental Leather"title="Oriental Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1115236ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1115236" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1172535">SMAinHK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-13">11/13/19 02:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells good, disappears in 1 hour, save your money for something better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1115236"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1115236#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1110933" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1110933" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JezzaN1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/694904"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.694904.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JezzaN1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1110933ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1110933" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/694904">JezzaN1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-29">10/29/19 19:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A really nice smelling fragrance, however at this pricepoint (or almost any pricepoint over $50aud really) i'm not going to purchase it, simply due to its awful performance. Are there any better performing alternatives out there?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1110933"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1110933#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1100372" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1100372" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OntheMark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1078464.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="OntheMark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Pour-Homme-II-1119.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1119.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Pour Homme II"title="Gucci Pour Homme II"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1100372ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1100372" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078464">OntheMark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-23">09/23/19 14:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Subtly dark and wispy in its lightness, Opus 1870 resides somewhere in that scorchy-woody-spicy space flanked by Azzaro Visit, Loewe 7 Anonimo and Gucci Pour Homme II, yet not blatantly similar to either.<br />
<br />
The connection others have drawn with Azzaro Visit is absolutely there - that smoky, woody, spicy goodness, though in this case, it's more suggestive of clove and cinnamon than Visit's pronounced nutmeg note. The smoky incense note is also more dry and churchy, bringing Anonimo to mind with that waft of "clove-smoking firebug who just burnt down a church" that is strange and at the same time magnetic. A light layer of very natural cinnamon - again dry, not sweet - reminds me of a very austere take on GPH II. Together, these notes are simply sublime to my nose - though I can imagine it might not be for everyone.<br />
<br />
Opus 1870 is not a freshie, nor is it a sweetened crowd pleaser. Its projection qualifies as intimate, wispy and ethereal - polite and mysterious, meant to draw the curious closer. This is a masterful execution of subtlety, a muted balance of spicy, scorched wood and a very dry incense. Poor sillage considerations aside, I honestly can't rave enough about this wonderful gem of a fragrance. Do I wish it had a bit more punch? Absolutely. But in every other way, I totally dig it.<br />
<br />
Definitely not your daily dumb grab, and for this reason I wouldn't recommend a blind buy - not at that cost. But fans of the aforementioned fragrances might very well appreciate the artistry of this unique take on some old favorites.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1100372"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1100372#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1085108" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1085108" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pempipot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178494.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pempipot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Cafe-Tuberosa-45964.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45964.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Caf Tuberosa"title="Caf Tuberosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1085108ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1085108" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178494">Pempipot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-08-06">08/06/19 03:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this one: it's so incredibly fresh, bright and peppery.<br />
The opening is SO fresh that it might as well fool you into thinking that it's just another citrus fragrance, but the coriander instantly corrects that. And then spices and cedar kicks in and turn it into a lovely woody spicy thing that is definitely warm.<br />
<br />
However this is a perfect scent for everyday, and I would not relegate it to winter because of the spicyness: it would be a pity.<br />
<br />
Longevity is, as always with Penhaligon's, quite a let down...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1085108"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1085108#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1076191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1076191" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andy the Frenchy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andy the Frenchy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1076191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1076191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781">Andy the Frenchy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-05">07/05/19 19:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favourite Penhaligon's on the fresh side, together with The Tragedy of Lord George. <br />
<br />
Pepper and cedar kept on the fresh side by the yuzu note, very transparent and airy (but not thin bodied), with a subtle oriental twist (rose/sweet spices/incense). By applying just after a shower (hydrated skin), I get good projection in the first hour, that then decreases to become moderate and then a skin scent after 6 hours. Longevity is average.<br />
<br />
Given the current pricing, it's a pass for Lord George, but a top-ranking on my buy list for this one!<br />
<br />
Spring/Fall days, 25+</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1076191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1076191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1073314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073314" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alanitoo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/230249"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.230249.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alanitoo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073314ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073314" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/230249">Alanitoo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-26">06/26/19 04:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opus is a really nice soft spicy, woody and balsamic scent, it's definitely on the lighter side and doesn't project a lot but it's very classy and i'm sure anyone can pull this off. but i believe for the 100+ sterling pounds price tag, we should be getting better projection. hence, i wouldn't be purchasing a full bottle of Opus. <br />
<br />
a big thumbs up for Penhaligon's for not testing on animals and being a cruelty free company unlike designer fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1073314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1073314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1063601" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1063601" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellme11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1070151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellme11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Empire-des-Indes-72955.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72955.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empire des Indes"title="Empire des Indes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1063601ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1063601" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151">smellme11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-24">05/24/19 08:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opus 1870 is a gentlemanly, sophisticated fragrance, with a similar vibe to Sartorial from the same house. I love them both. Opus is very woodsy with spice accents and a rosey tint. The Penhaligon's website lists the base notes as Cedarwood, Australian sandalwood, Musk, and Ciara wood.  If anyone can tell me what Ciara wood is, I'd love to know, lol. I have a feeling the woods are all Iso E Super.  I usually wear this EDT during the day if I'm going out all dressed up and dapper as to me, it doesn't seem to be a "casual" scent. Probably best for wintertime and for older folks (like me). I get 4 to 5 hours longevity, with a moderate sillage for the first hour.  Opus 1870 has been out for nearly 15 years, so online deal$ can be found easily, however, I recently checked the Penhaligon's website and it said Opus 1870 is out of stock, so it may be discontinued.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1063601"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1063601#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1060990" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1060990" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="meroo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.472277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="meroo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Tragedy-of-Lord-George-40716.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40716.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Tragedy of Lord George"title="The Tragedy of Lord George"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1060990ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1060990" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/472277">meroo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-16">05/16/19 09:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Edited review after a few months of wearing:<br />
Like it, don't love it. To me it is pepper all the way with some citrus and woodiness. I get very little rose if any.<br />
For the price, I would say there are better options, although I very much enjoy wearing this.<br />
<br />
One thing that I still didn't figure out is with which outfit, style or personality would that fit best. I like matching scents with outfits, weather and mood but this one never feels like a perfect match for any of the styles I try to pull off. It's too potent to be formal, too mature to be cool and young, too risky for dates, too expensive and spicy for home wear, not sporty at all and doesn't feel alternative or modern. So I don't know when this is best suited!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1060990"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1060990#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1036934" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1036934" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="12345"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150540"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1150540.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="12345" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Bel-Ami-Vetiver-22616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bel Ami Vetiver"title="Bel Ami Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1036934ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1036934" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150540">12345</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-02">03/02/19 06:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The cinnamon with the pepper, sandalwood, and rose give off that "tea" vibesimilar to GPHII and HM HiM. However, this has a heavier body to it, and is very smooth.<br />
<br />
The base is where the cinnamon mixes with the cedar, and it's wonderful. <br />
 More conservative, more confident, more assured.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="1036934"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=1036934#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent999945" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc999945" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragrant.regard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170037"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragrant.regard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma999945ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd999945" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1170037">Fragrant.regard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-11">11/11/18 10:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very strange how wonderful charisma so easily placates the  psychology of all of us.<br />
<br />
I bought this perfume not because I loved it, but because it was on reduction (apparently Penhaligons has done away with their 50ml sizes and were liquidating them at the time) and also because the sales lady who showed it to me was the most knowledgeable fragrance sales associate whom I have ever met. <br />
<br />
She said she fancied this perfume would be worn by Dorian Grey. Debonair (somewhat), soft (yes), masculine, edgy (not really) and suave. I don't entirely agree but I loved the analogy and felt obliged to offer a little commission to a woman who gave me over 1 and a half hours of her personal sales time.<br />
<br />
Anyways, it smells somewhat of what it is supposed to. Definitely peppery (perhaps black and pink), cedary (mainly ISO E), warm, and something faintly sweet and vanilla like in the dry down. Thankfully it doesn't smell of overdosed synthetic ambers which are so often mis(over)used to poor effect. If there is a sandalwood note, it isn't real; though I don't smell anything in that general direction.<br />
<br />
Regardless, if you like it and you can get it for the price which I stole it at, totally worth it. Otherwise, pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="999945"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=999945#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent999383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc999383" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ravanfar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983499"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.983499.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ravanfar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Sauvage-31861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sauvage"title="Sauvage"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma999383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd999383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983499">ravanfar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-09">11/09/18 12:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>         <br />
  <br />
     </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="999383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=999383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent998529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc998529" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pushtheskyaway"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1101285"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pushtheskyaway" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma998529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd998529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1101285">pushtheskyaway</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-07">11/07/18 12:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A beautiful scent, pure rose and black pepper, the opening and dry down are exactly the same, it never alters to my nose which is something I have also found with penhaligons Blenham Banquet, skin science must be a thing because this lasts and lasts on me, this will be a mainstay of my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="998529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=998529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent994909" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc994909" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zo_smells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1166000"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1166000.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zo_smells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Exaltatum/Osmanthus-Noble-49124.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49124.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Osmanthus Noble"title="Osmanthus Noble"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma994909ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd994909" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1166000">zo_smells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-26">10/26/18 08:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are fragrances/scents and there are memories of scents.<br />
For me, this is a memory of a scent that my fathers' suitcase smelled like when he would arrive from one of his long journeys abroad. I was a very young small child then and would often crawl in it, into this giant navy blue Samsonite, with my cat next to me and dream of traveling the world far, far away, on a journey to some exotic country.<br />
I never really liked my father, unfortunately.<br />
But I loved his suitcase and it's smell.<br />
And I absolutely looooooove Opus 1870 !</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="994909"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=994909#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent994791" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc994791" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma994791ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd994791" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-25">10/25/18 19:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opus 1870 is the fragrance I have been looking for. I got a sample from Lucky Scent and immediately loved it. The pepper smells great and the other notes go together to make a amazing fresh fragrance. I accidentally spilled some of the sample in my bathroom and I smell it when I got in. I bought a bottle and can't wait to start wearing it. I think it will become my daily fragrance I wear to work. Along with Sartorial and Lothair I am really starting to like Penhaligons more and more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="994791"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=994791#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent961640" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="961640"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=961640#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent911458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc911458" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SomeStubble"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113973"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1113973.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SomeStubble" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Byerley-31876.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31876.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Byerley"title="Byerley"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma911458ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd911458" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1113973">SomeStubble</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-14">02/14/18 00:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hamster cage. Fresh cage, not dirty cage. But shaved wood is all I get. <br />
I thought I must have gotten a dud so I went back to the store I first smelled it. <br />
I now actually think that tester bottle was stale. The hamster cage was there, just generally weaker and subdued. My bottle is a fresher more volatile version. <br />
<br />
Maybe Ill leave the lid off and sit it in the sun for a year then give it another try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="911458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=911458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent893131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc893131" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TonyTheTiger"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1091705"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1091705.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TonyTheTiger" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rosendo-Mateu-Olfactive-Expressions/Rosendo-Mateu-No-5-Floral-Amber-Sensual-Musk-46115.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46115.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosendo Mateu N 5 Floral, Amber, Sensual Musk"title="Rosendo Mateu N 5 Floral, Amber, Sensual Musk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma893131ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd893131" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1091705">TonyTheTiger</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-12-24">12/24/17 11:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Preamble: So many reviews say it has performance issues yet the longevity rating here is pretty good. This my clear it up...<br />
<br />
This was one of the first frags I bought after getting into them properly earlier this year so I've had some time with it now. I purchased it off the opening on a cardboard strip (school boy error I know!) The open stood out from everything else I has tried that day. <br />
<br />
Has 2 distinct phases the spicy opening is great but unfortunately short lived. The drydown is a rose musk and is _very_ long lasting. The drydown is synthetic smelling and has a plastic/saliva edge to it which I find unpleasant - it's not the smell I signed up for! The problem is that if I respray to get the opening again the drydown builds and builds and becomes sickly :/<br />
<br />
Even though I initially fell in love with this frag it's officially going down as a dislike now. I wore it last night to see if my opinion had changed, unfortunately not, the overall wearing experience was a 4/10 and I don't think I'll actually wear it again considering I've picked up so many awesome frags since then.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="893131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=893131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent875525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc875525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Flowerwood"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1004628.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Flowerwood" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma875525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd875525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004628">Flowerwood</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-30">10/30/17 00:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A spicy, citrus-fruity opening where woods and a touch of rose slowly comes into play to create a harmonious heart phase. Opus is fresh and friendly but still with some alerting vibes.<br />
The dry down is a slightly spicy wood fragrance where I imagine that some Yuzu stays in the game for a while.<br />
<br />
This is the first Yuzu centered fragrance I really like. To my nose Yuzu normally takes over and often becomes almost choking. In the case of Opus 1870 it is very well balanced with spices, rose and wood. <br />
If youre not into Yuzu fragrances but like to give it another chance, I really think Opus 1870 is worth a try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="875525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=875525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent852996" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc852996" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pavi_ne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1030543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pavi_ne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nicolai-Parfumeur-Createur/Patchouli-Intense-21352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouli Intense"title="Patchouli Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma852996ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd852996" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1030543">pavi_ne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-08-20">08/20/17 11:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A beautiful combination of woods and spices, masculine and mature, so very sexy. Alas, it literally died and disintegrated only 1 hour after spraying into something very faint and plasticky with absolutely no resemblance to the initial impressions. Too bad, I really had high hopes for this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="852996"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=852996#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent841040" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc841040" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wordley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wordley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-25780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LHomme Ideal"title="LHomme Ideal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma841040ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd841040" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009056">Wordley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-13">07/13/17 13:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Basically, the whole point of wearing a fragrance is to smell nice, and for others to notice that you smell nice.  This should last for a few hours, at least.  With 1870 it doesn't.  And frankly, given the prices Penhaligon charge, that's just not good enough.<br />
<br />
If you enjoy shelling out your hard-earned cash on a very quick burst of pepper, followed by incense, followed by sandalwood followed rapidly by nothing, then buy this.  If not, then don't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="841040"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=841040#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent831013" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc831013" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hosseinm128"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/830505"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.830505.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hosseinm128" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma831013ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd831013" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/830505">Hosseinm128</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-10">06/10/17 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>                          <br />
                 <br />
        </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="831013"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=831013#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent804712" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc804712" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amirali0072000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/869421"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.869421.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amirali0072000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-Eau-de-Parfum-37735.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37735.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"title="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma804712ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd804712" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/869421">amirali0072000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-22">03/22/17 08:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An Spicy, Woody and fresh scent from heaven. I have smelled black Pepper, Cedar and Yuzu in this magnificent product the most. Both longevity and projection are moderate. It is a fragrance for all season. It is better to use it in day rather than night. It is a perfume for male and I suppose it is not suitable for very young people.<br />
      </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="804712"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=804712#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent801632" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc801632" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Leopold"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1053054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1053054.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Leopold" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Cardinal-7844.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7844.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cardinal"title="Cardinal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma801632ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd801632" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1053054">Leopold</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-13">03/13/17 04:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Now that's a strange one. It's amongst my favourite fragrances but I don't have it and I never had it. I actually got samples so I could try it on various occasions. What can I say? I love it. It's fresh, it's woody. It's not generic. It's classy. I love the Penhaligon's image and packaging in general but this one is my favourite. So why I never bought it? Because it's expensive but projection and longevity are a disaster. And apparently a lot of people agree on that. I want this perfume and I'll buy it one day for sure. I'm just waiting for an opportunity to get it cheaper because it's performance does not match its price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="801632"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=801632#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent794356" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc794356" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MountainviewK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MountainviewK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/Curzon-Cologne-4998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Curzon Cologne"title="Curzon Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma794356ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd794356" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551">MountainviewK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-19">02/19/17 08:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me, this is a strange one. When I spray it on I get a nice woodsy smell - for about two seconds - and then it seems to disappear. It becomes a skin scent almost immediately. When I put my nose to skin I get a pleasant woodsy, floral fragrance but there is almost no fragrance there. This problem is probably particular to me, but there it is. Although I like the smell I have to rate it a dislike due to the extraordinarily weak projection and longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="794356"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=794356#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent764718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc764718" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bugsyiii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/961762"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.961762.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bugsyiii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-d-Homme-3794.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3794.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion d'Homme"title="Infusion d'Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma764718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd764718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/961762">bugsyiii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-26">11/26/16 16:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really love the combination of Ciara Wood, Cedarwood, Australian Sandalwood, and Black Pepper in the opening. The Rose and Yuzu Fruit gives this fragrance the balance it needs to stand out among others. I just received this and I'm in love!! [As a side note...in Opus 1870's dry down, I detect a very reminiscent opening of Merchant Loup's woodiness, yet, unique. On the flip-side, resembles Frapin's L'Humaniste majorly!]<br />
<br />
Overall, a lovely fragrance that I am going to have a field-day wearing!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="764718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=764718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent760903" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc760903" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma760903ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd760903" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-13">11/13/16 16:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very likeable. I find Yuzu a really enjoyable fragrance note, it's quite moreish, but never has enough strength to it. Opus is very finely balanced, well made and put together. It's not particularly strong or exciting though. When it comes down to it, this Penhaligon is not worth the money. <br />
<br />
I actually enjoyed the shower gel more than the perfume. Think this kind of scent works better in products than perfume. I would really like a wider range of products where they use this scent.<br />
<br />
If you had to buy a gift for someone you knew nothing about you'd probably buy them something like this.<br />
<br />
6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="760903"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=760903#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent733174" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
