Then I realised it's quite a masculine scent haha! But I love it and I gave that bottle to my brother, on men it's perfect. I wish I had a little sample of this just to sniff it time to time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="733174"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=733174#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent729196" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc729196" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumesamplesanddecants"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1011946"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1011946.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumesamplesanddecants" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma729196ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd729196" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1011946">perfumesamplesanddecants</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-03">08/03/16 09:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very classy gentlemen's scent, we really love this fragrance from Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="729196"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=729196#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent714611" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc714611" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cizekon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004149"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cizekon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lanvin/Lanvin-L-Homme-6094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lanvin L'Homme"title="Lanvin L'Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma714611ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd714611" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004149">cizekon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-13">06/13/16 12:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As a scent begginer, I lately felt in love with the house of Penhaligons, especially with their Endymion and Esprit du Roi. For that reason, I was really curious about this one.<br />
<br />
The scent itself is quite interesting - fresh and clean mix of citruses, pepper and spicies that smells really gently. Totally unisex. <br />
<br />
Unfortunately, it disappeared almost immediately - after 30 minutes I wasnt able to notice anything. I had to give the bottle back, since Im not willing to pay for the fragrances with non-existing longevity and sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="714611"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=714611#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent703626" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc703626" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="atlaseetschristmas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/842607"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.842607.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="atlaseetschristmas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Slumberhouse/Fjerne-61819.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61819.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fjerne"title="Fjerne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma703626ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd703626" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/842607">atlaseetschristmas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-08">05/08/16 14:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really nice brownish peppery opening evolves into a slightly underwhelming citrus-cedar blend that it a bit too indistinct to be engaging to me. Theres some nice smoky/spicy undertones that show up in the dry down giving it a sort of light-oriental vibe, but unfortunately it only hangs around for a couple of hours before fading away to nothing. Good, but not mind-blowing.<br />
6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="703626"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=703626#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent680719" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Some free association here: cedar-y woods, crisp but not sharp, serious but doesn't take itself seriously.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="680719"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=680719#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent654869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Reminds me of wearing an expensive talc under my clothes that emits a light scent when my skin rubs against material.  Suitable to wear anywhere by anyone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="654869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=654869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent618019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc618019" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pianomelody"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.775391.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pianomelody" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Bapteme-du-Feu-39436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baptme du Feu"title="Baptme du Feu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma618019ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd618019" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391">Pianomelody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-08-04">08/04/15 13:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Elegant,old,friendly ... these are the first words that come after hearing Opus 1870 ... it evokes old libraries, and characters of that time. The base notes begin immediately with pepper very powerful, along with notes Yuzu and coriander that "softenen" the initial power of the pepper. The incense and cedar give a nice touch to the composition, in the base notes the fragrance gets warmer. Smells good but it's not one of my favorites of Penhaligon's.<br />
<br />
Sillage: 6/10<br />
Longevity: 7/10<br />
Scent: 6.5/10<br />
<br />
Overall: 6.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="618019"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=618019#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604165" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604165" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.927134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-Eau-de-Toilette-31969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"title="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604165ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604165" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134">racb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-15">06/15/15 11:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow what is this all about?<br />
<br />
My initial reaction was "muck heap", then as it settled I could tell there was something horsey about it.... It smells like a tack shop with a slightly mentholy or toothpaste background scent.<br />
<br />
Not an unpleasant smell per se, but I don't really want to smell of tack shops, even though they are lovely places by and large.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="604165"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=604165#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent594874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc594874" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="koala501"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/53430"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="koala501" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma594874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd594874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/53430">koala501</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-15">05/15/15 02:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm not a pepper fan- perhaps I've just not encountered a good blend. That all changed with this masterpiece by Penhaligon's. Now the weather has cooled in my part of Australia I wanted something with class, something masculine with woods. I am a citrus fan but wanted a warmer edge. I love this!!!The yuzu plumps this up somewhat and the lovely rose in the background gives a nod to past days though this is a modern twist. Class in a bottle Opus 1870 will be in my wardrobe for a very, very long time. Actually, I'll never be without it!!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="594874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=594874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent556311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc556311" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ruffienne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.821453.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ruffienne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma556311ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd556311" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453">Ruffienne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-07">01/07/15 17:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oregano, lemons, coriander, even a little capsicum (but not black pepper per se) ... what is this?  The opening of a fragrance, or the opening of an antipasto platter?  :-)<br />
<br />
This fragrance is vigorous and bright - even a little bit alarming to begin with - but quite rapidly morphs into something far softer, milder and warmer. <br />
<br />
In the dry-down it displays smooth woody elements and harmonous musks and florals, and becomes far more unisex than the opening notes would indicate.<br />
<br />
It layers well with solifores (lily, bulgarian rose) and becomes decidedly feminine in the process.<br />
<br />
I like this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="556311"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=556311#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent555063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/619688">jeanuk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-03">01/03/15 13:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>lovely fragrance for men, 30 plus..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="555063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=555063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent535618" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc535618" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jtay"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/24169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.24169.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jtay" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma535618ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd535618" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/24169">Jtay</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-27">10/27/14 11:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very warm and attractive men's fragrance (from a female point of view). Sexy but not the least bit sleazy. One of my top two favorite male fragrances (for men, not me). It feels to masculine for me to wear... But I love it so much I might just wear it anyways!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="535618"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=535618#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent535385" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc535385" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="KIZILBAY"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820769"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.820769.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="KIZILBAY" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tauer-Perfumes/02-L-Air-du-Desert-Marocain-4573.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4573.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="02 L'Air du Desert Marocain"title="02 L'Air du Desert Marocain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma535385ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd535385" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820769">KIZILBAY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-26">10/26/14 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Kokularn hafizamizdan gemi gnleri, kiileri, olaylar, baz gda ve rnleri cagristirdigini hepimiz biliyoruz. Bu konuda ciddi bilimsel almalar var. Bazen kokular yukarda sraladm gibi belirgin bir kii ya da maddeyi deil bir atmosferi artrr. Penhaligon's bu konuda baarl bir marka. Opus ilk kokladigimda bana ahap youn tasarlanm ve Avrupa da bir lkedeki alma odasn hatrlatt. Bunun nedenini bilmiyorum. Belki bir uzmanla konumam durumunda nedenini ogrenebilirim.<br />
Koku batan sona fazla bir deiim gstermiyor. Hemen hemen ayn kalyor. Birlesimini okuduumda ardm. nceden rastlamadm bir nota-koku bekliyordum. Ancak bildiim ve hep rastladm bir bileimi var. Ancak sanrm oranlar ve bileim buna neden oluyor.<br />
Kesinlikle karakterli bir koku. Bu kokuya gzel, harika, baarl falan demek istemiyorum. En ok hak ettii iltifat bence karakterli olduu. <br />
Her mevsim kullanlabilir. Ofis ortamlarnda hi rahatszlk yaratmaz. 35 ya st iin uygun. Takm elbise ile bir aksesuar niyetine kullanlabilir. Agresif deil, akdenizli deil, yakkl deil. Grm geirmi, guvenilir, dengeli bir adam var karmzda.<br />
<br />
Ancak haftasonlar biraz daha elenceli koku tercih edebilirsiniz. Yani bu birazda haftaici iin uygun. <br />
Tabiki ten zerinde denemeden almamak lazm. nk kokularn hepimiz iin farkl anlamlar var. Belirli bir kalitenin stnde olduu iin "kt" bulmayacaginizi tahmin ediyorum. Ancak begenmeyebilirsiniz. Belki de bu koku size lise yllarnda kk sktren Kimya hocamizi hatirlatacaktir, kim bilir.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="535385"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=535385#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent433902" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc433902" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="srt33"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/372035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="srt33" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Agonist/Liquid-Crystal-11010.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11010.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Liquid Crystal"title="Liquid Crystal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma433902ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd433902" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/372035">srt33</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-08">12/08/13 15:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tested this one at the same time as Molton Brown Black Pepper. My surprise when I got a lot of black pepper on this one, and none in the one with the same name as the note itself. Besides the pepper, I get some smoky incense, hints of corriander, and a sort of bitter citrus from the yuzu. Seems very weak on my skin. Its ok, was expecting more given the reviews.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="433902"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=433902#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent410493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc410493" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tonix8"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64825"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.64825.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tonix8" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Omnia-Amethyste-780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Omnia Amethyste"title="Omnia Amethyste"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma410493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd410493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64825">tonix8</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-27">09/27/13 11:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite men's fragrance. Calm, woody, dry, but sweet as well. It makes me feel like I'm sitting in a quiet corner of an old library full of precious books.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="410493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=410493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent394694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc394694" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma394694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd394694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-10">08/10/13 05:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Probably one of the most masculine of theirs that I've tried. A surprisingly transparent cedar, sweet and mild without the common acrid undertones. Much smoother than Visit, Rush, etc., and perhaps closer to a more subdued Rocabar. The deep foresty-ness is there, but is much more raw, natural and unadulterated. As it develops, it gets sweeter, with what I believe to be nutmeg...again very much like Visit but more natural and less obtrusive. It's weak, which I don't mind, but it's also oddly incomplete. I'm not sure what else I would have had them add, but it's one of those scents that feels like half a composition, no doubt because they've purposely left it simple. By the end, the spices become very heady, so even though you have to sniff vey close to smell it, it's lost some of its appeal as far as I'm concerned. Like Racquets, the far base is a bit like Geir if you only sniff it briefly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="394694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=394694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent388709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc388709" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aussiecrew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.534128.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aussiecrew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma388709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd388709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128">aussiecrew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-22">07/22/13 02:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Crisp air, bright sun, beautiful people, darling clothing, fresh talk and a man wearing Penhaligon's Opus 1870. Here is the all purpose, well travelled scholar with refinement and elegance. A gentleman, mature with sophistocation and poise. Looking, smelling and appearing great is Opus 1870. Never dull and always stirring the atmosphere with an aroma of joy. Say it again 'Opus 1870' wear it well Ol'Chum!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="388709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=388709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent383907" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc383907" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Haptica"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/556082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.556082.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Haptica" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Moon-Carnival-51930.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51930.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moon Carnival"title="Moon Carnival"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma383907ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd383907" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/556082">Haptica</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-06">07/06/13 15:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><i>This is the power of scent upon our bodies.</i> <br />
<br />
It was late on a splendid Saturday afternoon. I was listening to Les Trois Mousquetaires on audiolivres and I was bored bored bored. I began sharpening my eyebrow pencils, and one thing leading to another, I opened my newly arrived Penhaligon's "Recueil des Parfums". Frankly up until now it was a disappointment. Bluebell, Blenheim Bouquet ... disappointing. My nose had been underwhelmed, at the same time I was completely aware that these were mature, complex and worthy scents. I tried to like them ... I really tried. Then I spilled some Opus 1870 onto my wrist and in an instant I was delving into the recesses of my closet for my adventure clothes, had smeared kohl around my eyes, and was looking for something to accentuate my waist--preferably a sword. I wanted to be dueling l'homme de Meung. I wanted to be racing across the Mongolian plains on horseback, chased by outraged Huns. <br />
<br />
<b>Opus 1870</b> is liquid Steampunk. It is leathery and sandalwoody, with a hint of civilized rose. It is bodily adventure in a bottle. <br />
<br />
And that, my friends, is the power of scent:  the power to transform an everyday day into a spectacularly adventurous one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="383907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=383907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent367427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc367427" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LandHo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/417179"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.417179.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LandHo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/Velvet-Wood-13743.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13743.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Velvet Wood"title="Velvet Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma367427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd367427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/417179">LandHo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-17">05/17/13 05:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know the "This perfume reminds me of _________" section is about as subjective as it comes but as someone who has just tried Opus 1870 and has Gucci Pour Homme II as his signature scent I can't help but notice a Strong similarity.  Granted only 2 notes are similar between the two (cinnamon and musk) but the overall light, classy feel and scent are nearly the same (to me).  There is a slight less sweetness to 1870 but unless you inhale it deeply it's not that noticeable.  I'm glad to find something else similar to GPH2 and, as of this wearing of 1870, would highly recommend it.  I guess we'll see if the masses agree...<br />
<br />
**And I guess the people have spoken...it went from 3 "yes" in the "reminds me of" GPH2 to nada.  That's fine.  I'll wear it again and unless the sample I was sent from First In Fragrance was wrong I'll continue to be COMPLETELY reminded of GPH2 every time I wear 1870.**</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="367427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=367427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent364157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc364157" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spumyland"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189882"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.189882.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spumyland" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maher-Olfactive/Santal-Auster-60618.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60618.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Auster"title="Santal Auster"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma364157ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd364157" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189882">spumyland</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-08">05/08/13 08:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>fragranza classica ed elegante buona e frizzante.<br />
100% maschile.adatta di giorno &amp; over 40.<br />
Trasuda esperienza.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="364157"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=364157#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent335507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc335507" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="semj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/34854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.34854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="semj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Hala-82813.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.82813.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hala"title="Hala"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma335507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd335507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/34854">semj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-02-14">02/14/13 00:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For the true gentelman. This fellow dresses strictly in grey suits by day and slippers and a cravatt at night. He is very proper and hard to get to know. Icy and academic.<br />
The citrus opening clashes with the peppar and makes you intersted. A dry woody drydown keeps you earthed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="335507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=335507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent331365" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc331365" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Weihan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/369178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Weihan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Spice-and-Wood-10101.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10101.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spice and Wood"title="Spice and Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma331365ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd331365" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/369178">Weihan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-02-01">02/01/13 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Opus 1870 is one of the finest fragrances out there, bar none. The opening notes are a splendid blend of citrus and pepper, which quickly dries down to a wonderfully subtle hint of pepper exquisitely placed on a bed of wood and rose with just a hint of cinnamon. Of course preferences are in the nose of the tester, but in my experience, few fragrances can compete with Opus 1870 for understated class and elegance. The only drawback is the relatively modest sillage. Longevity however is wonderful, and you'll be tempted to repeatedly sniff your wrists for hours on end. Opus 1870 is simply SUBLIME!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="331365"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=331365#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent305496" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc305496" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="naapio"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/180875"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.180875.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="naapio" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Couvent-Maison-de-Parfum/Cologne-of-the-Missions-18811.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18811.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cologne of the Missions"title="Cologne of the Missions"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma305496ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd305496" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/180875">naapio</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-20">11/20/12 01:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If Serge Lutens Chne and Chanel Egoste had a baby, what would it be like? Absolutely stunning and very close to this creation, I imagine.<br />
<br />
If you like dry woods, smokey incense, rose, and cinnamon with a peppery twist and finally a light musky base then you should give Opus a try. I have sampled this twice now and I've had none of the longevity or sillage problems some reviews have mentioned. A few dabs from my sample tube last nicely 8 hours without reapplication and while Opus stays relatively close to skin it still manages to make itself known every know and then without me having to press my nose to it.<br />
<br />
Opus is a slightly more feminine perfume than I expected, but beautiful nonetheless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="305496"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=305496#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent302942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc302942" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zenith"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/206253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zenith" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Salvador-Dali/Black-Sun-1112.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1112.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Sun"title="Black Sun"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma302942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd302942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/206253">Zenith</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-12">11/12/12 02:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely, something I could wear every day with ease.... if it had any longevity to speak of.  Have tried it twice now, once applying with my usual quantity and then being a bit more heavy handed.  Unfortunately it completely lost all character within three hours.  I love the nice clean pepper most of all, with a nice background of woods and other spices, but such a nice opening fades quickly.<br />
<br />
Leaves me wondering why companies spend so much time creating lovely works of art only to dissapoint by being so fleeting.  Oh well, if you have a nice occasion that requires a suit and a bit of class and goes for less than two hours you have found your choice</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="302942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=302942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent283869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc283869" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fezziwig"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/134858"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.134858.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fezziwig" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Essenza-di-Colonia-9829.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9829.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Essenza di Colonia"title="Essenza di Colonia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma283869ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd283869" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/134858">Fezziwig</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-09-09">09/09/12 16:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am a Penhaligon fan but Opus 1870 is the least favorite of mine. Too 'Hot' &amp; Spicy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="283869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=283869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent276657" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc276657" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mejohann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/196086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.196086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mejohann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lubin/Black-Jade-13013.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13013.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Jade"title="Black Jade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma276657ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd276657" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/196086">mejohann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-08-16">08/16/12 01:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It must just be me, but this smelled exactly like a pet shop that I spent many hours of my childhood in. The wood shavings in the bottom of dog and rodent cages? Yeah  . . . it smells exactly like Opus. I had very high hopes, but I could NOT get past the connection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="276657"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=276657#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent261884" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc261884" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ericrico"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/92968"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.92968.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ericrico" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Egoiste-613.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.613.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Egoiste"title="Egoiste"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma261884ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd261884" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/92968">ericrico</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-22">06/22/12 14:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a truly elegant and very nice composition - a niche-quality offering with excellent ingredients!  What I like is how it is so well-blended and the fragrance shows both balance and harmony.<br />
<br />
Personally, while I feel it could be unisex (if worn by the right woman - confidence, class, sophistication and sassiness required - :-) ), but this is a more of a masculine scent to me as a whole.<br />
<br />
The coriander and fresh-ground pepper open with just a squeeze of yuzu (one of my favorite citruses) - a sparkling top that is one I really like.  The transition into the heart offers plumes of smoky incense that emerges seamlessly with warm ground cinnamon and the brilliant lush rose peaking through. Great stage in the fragrance as all the spices play perfectly together and the incense is very natural - more olibanum than anything overtly "head shop"...refined.  The rose incorporated in here is the brilliance (and what allows it to be a possible unisex bottling).  Not a deep rose - more of a lighter, closed bud at first with the bloom just starting to open along with the rich dusting of spices on the petals &amp; incense wafting throughout...exquisite.<br />
<br />
The dry down starts with (from my perspective) the Virginia cedar that has a very natural and fresh-cut quality, with some of the dustiness coming in from the spices and incense which lasts into the base (but lightens - sort of a fade/drifting effect that is natural).  Very pretty - I am more impressed as this develops.  I then detect a nice clean white musk note that lifts the fragrance as the spices dissipate and the incense is now really no more than a nuance (faint note) in the fragrance. The final note that enters is the warm and smooth sandalwood - a quality ingredient that helps the rose carry through.  Sandalwood is now precious and this has a very nice, niche feel to it.  Not a rose-dominant scent at all, but a well-incorporated note in the overall scent pyramid - which I wanted to revisit.  The rose never fully blooms for me, but it lingers wonderfully with the wood. <br />
<br />
Overall, I find this to be exceptional!  I have been wearing various lighter niche Eau de Colognes that retail for a good amount of money that have excellent top notes, spices (including pepper), incense, and fully-integrated wood including rare varietals.  This stands easily at their level and is actually a bit deeper due to its Eau de Toilette strength, which was my main reason of interest - notes that I love with perhaps more richness.  No disappointment.<br />
<br />
Excellent review by Jack_Hunter here and sherapop offers a good perspective as well.  It is not a loud scent, but one for the wearer and those very close to enjoy.<br />
<br />
Very good bottle, indeed.  One that I see wearing in Spring and Fall or cooler Summer nights.  I think this will work in Winter, but not on the coldest days - it would be a nice, refreshing scent on rainy days for sure here in California.  My initial wearing tells me that it would project and last better with a bit of warmth and application to clothing also helps.  <br />
<br />
Overall score - 8.5+/10.  Recommended.  One of the best from the house...?  For me, yes!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="261884"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=261884#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent217602" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc217602" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chaosvirtu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/134444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.134444.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="chaosvirtu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Marc-Sinan/Sinan-14107.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14107.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sinan"title="Sinan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma217602ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd217602" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/134444">chaosvirtu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-01-21">01/21/12 17:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is heavenly soft, warm, woods and flowers. Zero sweetness, fruits, or desserts, So my dream scent. I could happily wear this every day. I have a small sample of this, and I hope I can get a bottle soon, as I would love to spray rather than dab. Smells great on  me, but it would smell dangerously sexy on a man.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="217602"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=217602#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent199374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc163813" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jack_Hunter"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/51999"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.51999.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jack_Hunter" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma163813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd163813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/51999">Jack_Hunter</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-07-10">07/10/11 03:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have tried most of the range from this house and Opus 1870 for me stood out as the best. It opens with a really good peppery cedar wood scent with a beautiful Rose fragrance coming through in the background. As time moves on the Rose comes to the forefront and the woods move into the background. <br />
<br />
 I find the scent elegant and refined and also restrained in the manner that it is never overwhelming but just compliments the wearer perfectly. A great woody floral that I found worthy of a purchase of a 100ml bottle and one that I am glad is part of my wardrobe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="7052"comment_id="163813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Opus-1870-7052.html?ccid=163813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent148503" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
